intro: Tetrasida tulla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tetrasida, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-related species. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically in green or reddish bracts, and are pollinated by insects. Tetrasida tulla is often found in rocky or arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its drought-resistant properties.
